text:
When I entered high school, I wanted to become a pastry chef. My parents convinced me to have my "baccalauréat" first, and then go to a pastry school.
During my three year of high school, most of my friend wanted to go on computer science related studies, and little by little, I wanted to know more about this field. In the last year of high school, when we had to choose in which school we wanted to continue our studies, I wanted to try a computer science school. All I knew about was INSA and polytech. But my father told me : "I often work with ESIR's students, there are very good at their jobs, even if the school is not as known as the INSA". That is the reason why I put the ESIR in my list. However, I had never written code, so it was a bet. Maybe after the first year, I would have been traumatized by computer science, and wanted to try something else.
Moreover, I still enjoy cooking, but when I have chosen ESIR instead of a pastry school, I told myself : "I can try to become a pastry chef with a computer science diploma, but not a computer science engineer with a diploma from a pastry school".
I have kept two ideas as spare wheels, to become either a teacher in high school (probably a math teacher), or a pastry chef. But they are very difficult jobs, so I really hope that I will get my diploma in computer science.
In conclusion, my bet was successful. I really love what I am doing right now, and even if I am sometimes frustrated when we are doing more mathematics than computer science, I think it was the best decision I could make.
